chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin K. Bressette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Granted good time and work release under the terms of the Sheriff.
Consecutive to: Count 3 and consecutive to any other sentence.

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment. 
Payment plan of $20 a month on the first of the month beginning 60 days after release and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

records.addlTxt: 9:47 AM Defendant Benjamin K. Bressette appeared by video, in custody from Bayfield County Jail.  Attorney Martin J Lipske appeared by video for Benjamin K. Bressette.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney pleas have been entered in Bayfield County, set sentencing date for 11/1/22, attorney and def ready to go forward.  State is fine to proceed.  Parties have an agreement.  Def waives right to personal appearance, discussed with atty.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowing, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving right and accepts waiver.  Atty def PLEADS NO CONTEST, admits that is a repeater as to each count.  File contains PLQ, understands info and right giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowing, voluntarily, and intelligently pleading no contest, and accepts NO CONTEST PLEAS.  As a factual basis can court rely on the compliant filed, parties agree, court finds a factual basis exists and finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State, has complied with victim rights.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments.  See attached offer to settle for sentencing.
Email sent to BCJ advising def has court on Aug 12;  ka

Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Offer with a case from Bayfield county that wont happen till Tuesday 8/9, this case is contingent on Bayfield county case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.

02:30 PM Defendant Benjamin K. Bressette appeared by video means from Bayfield Cty Jail . Prosecuting Atty David Meany appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Marty Lipske appears for def.  Does not have mailing address, no residential address.  Atty has talked to def today, currently on revocatioin for bayfield county jail, three cases pending there, going back to prison.  State comments on bail/bond, sign bond non-monetary conditions with all court orders.  Atty comments on bail bond with bayfield county cases.  No initial appearnace today, will schedule that.  State can provide information by monday. $10,000 sign.   Initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:29 AM - Defendant Benjamin K. Bressette not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin via vcon.  COVID - ZOOM; no proof of service, but is fel.  Ct rev'd compl, finds PC def com fel in Co, nationwide warrant for arrest, BOW.
